package.translation[0].definitions[0].de: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
package.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Thereâ€™s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
package.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the paper or plastic container that food or other goods are sold in
package.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a set of ideas or services that are suggested or offered all together as a group
package.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The government has announced a package of measures to assist affected areas.
Many banks are offering financial packages for students.
package.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a set of related programs sold together for use on a computer
package.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent
package.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The code informs us where and when a product was packaged.
The videos were packaged up, ready for distribution.
package.translation[1].definitions[0].no: Package is usually passive in this meaning
package.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to prepare something for sale, especially by making it attractive or interesting to a particular group of people
package.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: They try to package their product to give it mass appeal.
package.translation[2].definitions[0].de: an amount of something or a number of things, packed together and wrapped up ready to be sent somewhere
package.translation[2].definitions[1].de: a small container with a set of things in it
package.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a set of related things, services, or proposals that are sold or presented together
package.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: the best-sellingdesktop publishing package on the market
Interco is urging bondholders to accept a package of new securities.
The company announced a package of cost-cutting measures.
package.translation[2].definitions[3].de: the pay and things such as holidays, pensions etc that you get with a particular job
package.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to wrap or pack something so that it is ready to be sent somewhere
package.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Many firms send components overseas to be packaged.
materials for packaging food and consumer products
package.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to put goods or services together and sell them as a set
package.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: The company packaged the software with other IBM products.
package.translation[3].definitions[2].de: to prepare something for sale, especially by adding something to it or by making it more attractive to buyers
package.translation[3].definitions[2].ex: She built a video empire by packaging her own fitness routines and selling them to millions of Americans.
package.translation[3].definitions[3].de: if a financial institution packages loans, it buys the loans from lenders such as banks and uses the loans as BACKING for bonds. The financial institution uses the repayments on these loans to make payments to investors who buy the bonds. Money that the lenders get from the financial institution when it sells the bonds is used to make more loans to customers
package.translation[3].definitions[3].ex: As seller of the mortgages, American Mortage forwarded repayments to the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation, which had bought the loans and packaged them into securities.
